analysis.narrative:
ðŸ“Š **Consensus:** Market sentiment is MIXED with medium conviction. Twitter shows strong bullish lean (80%), but RSS News reveals underlying weakness with 63% bullish and documented earnings misses offsetting macro optimism. The divergence suggests traders are bullish on forward narratives (stimulus, rate cuts, AI CapEx) while price action reflects present-tense headwinds (guidance cuts, regulatory friction, geopolitical risk).

ðŸ“ˆ **Themes:** (1) Rate-cut expectations and monetary easing as primary bull narrative vs. macro fragility with record global debt levels ($346T) as primary bear narrative; (2) AI and productivity gains narrative conflicting with documented earnings guidance misses in software/fintech sectors; (3) Year-end positioning and sentiment extremes creating binary outcomesâ€”either validation of bull case or correction trigger.

ðŸŽ¯ **Levels:** SPY ($690.31): Call Wall $700 (146k OI - active), Put Wall $640 (153k OI - dormant). Max Pain $686. Near support: $670 (45k OI - active). key_themes: Rate cut expectations and monetary easing
AI productivity gains vs. earnings execution reality
Earnings guidance misses in growth sectors
risk_factors: Record $346T global debt creating macro fragility (bearish tail risk)
Documented earnings guidance cuts in software/fintech (demand destruction signal)
Regulatory announcements on banking capital requirements and financial sector constraints
Geopolitical tensions creating safe-haven flows and sector rotation
Sentiment complacency despite macro risks (historically crash-precursor signal)
analysis.intraday_levels: Watch SPY $700 Call Wall for active resistance (146k OI actively hedged). Support at $670 (45k OI actively hedged, 2.9% away). QQQ facing resistance $625-$630 (active hedging). Per Twitter analysis: /ES behavior at 6550 is critical bearish/bullish dividing line.
